questions.uddipok:
Read the passage. Then answer the questions below:
Humans can neither change the sun's radiation nor the earth's orbit around the sun. But they can control the increase in the amount of greenhouse gases and its effect on the atmosphere. Only during the last hundred years the carbon dioxide concentration has been raised alarmingly in the atmosphere and we humans can be held responsible for this.
The main cause of the increase in carbon dioxide level in the atmosphere is the burning of fossil fuels. Since the end of the 19th century, industrial activities increased rapidly giving rise to many factories. These factories required energy, which was produced through the combustion of coal. Besides coal, other sources of energy such as mineral oil and natural gas were also burned to heat our houses, run cars and airplanes or to produce electricity. Nowadays, about 85 million barrels of crude oil are burned daily. Every time a fossil raw material is burned, it releases.carbon dioxide into the air.
Therefore, it is clear that more and more greenhouse gases like carbon dioxide are being generated worldwide by humans. Moreover, we are also strengthening the greenhouse effect by deforestation, which means cutting down trees. Every year enormous areas of forests are destroyed by people to obtain wood and to clear regions for mining and to create pasture. This loss of the forest causes dual problems. Trees that are burned up release large volumes of carbon dioxide gas into the air. On the other hand, as forest absorb a lot of carbon dioxide from the air and deliver oxygen instead, we also destroy an important storehouse of carbon dioxide when we clear forests.
Choose the correct answer from the alternatives:

Read the following text and fill in each gap with a suitable word based on the information of the text:

Zainul Abedin (29 December, 1914-28 May. 1976) was a Bangladeshi painter. He had an extraordinary talent and was internationally recognized for his paintings. He became well-known in 1944 through his series of paintings on the great man-made famine in Bengal during British Colonial rule.

He played a vital role in the art movement in Bangladesh and was the founding Principal of the Government Institute of Arts (Now Faculty of Fine Arts) at University of Dhaka. His paintings on Bengal famine are considered as his most characteristic works. His homeland honoured him with the title 'Shilpacharya' or the great teacher of arts for his artistic and visionary qualities. He was a pioneer of the modern art movement and was rightly considered as the founding father of Bangladeshi modern arts.


Question:
Zainul Abedin is considered as a (a) ——— of Bangladeshi modern art. He was an (b) —— of outstanding talent. He gained international (c) ——— through his series of paintings on famine in 1944. In his paintings he showed his (d) ——— and visionary qualities. Even today he is (e) ——— Shilpacharya.

sub_questions.explanation: (a) pioneer (b) artist (c) recognition (d) artistic (e) honoured as l Called

questions.uddipok:
Read the following text and answer the questions.
Charles Babbage was an English mathematician. He was also a mechanical engineer who is well-known for originating the concept of computer. He was born on 26 December 1791 in London. He entered Trinity College in October 1810 . He was transferred to Peterhouse, Cambridge. He was the top mathematician there. He received an honorary degree without examination in 1814 . He was elected a fellow of the Royal University in 1816. Babbage is famous for inventing the first mechanical computer in 1822 that eventually led to today's computer. He died at his home in London on 18 October 1871.


Write a summary of the above passage in your own words.

sub_questions.explanation: Charles Babbage was an English mathematician and mechanical engineer, born on 26th December 1791 in London. He is widely recognized for originating the concept of the computer. Babbage entered Trinity College in 1810 and later transferred to Peterhouse, Cambridge, where he became the top mathematician. In 1814, he received an honorary degree and was elected a fellow of the Royal University in 1816. Babbage is most famous for inventing the first mechanical computer in 1822, which laid the foundation for the development of modern computers. He passed away in London on 18th October 1871.

questions.uddipok:
Answer the following questions to write a paragraph on 'Environment Pollution' in 200 words.
(a) What do you mean by "Environment Pollution"? (b) What are the elements of Environment? (c) How are the elements being polluted? (d) What are the effects of pollution? (e) What should we do to get rid of environment pollution?

sub_questions.explanation:
Environment Pollution
The surroundings in which a person, animal or plant lives is called environment. There are many elements in our environment. Air, water, soil, plants, animals, etc. are such elements. They are essential for the environment as well as human beings. These elements should be sound for our sound living. But when they are polluted and their essential balance is disrupted, this phenomenon is known as environmental pollution. Nowadays, almost everywhere, the environment is being seriously polluted. In many places of our country, the environment has become extremely polluted. Actually, we ourselves are responsible for this severe pollution. Industries and factories emit huge amount of smoke, gases and fume. Motor vehicles also emit large amount of smoke and gases. All these pollute air seriously and polluted air is very harmful for us. Moreover, water is polluted due to dumping of industrial wastes and by chemical fertilizers and insecticides which are washed away into rivers and canals. Due to indiscriminate use of vehicle horns, loud speakers, mikes, etc. sound is polluted. Soil is polluted by harmful chemical fertilizers and insecticides. Besides, people are cutting down trees at random. All these are causing environmental pollution. Consequently, man becomes sick, animals and fishes are getting reduced, global warming is increasing, polar icecaps are melting, frequent floods are occurring and so on. So, we all should be aware of this harmful pollution and take effective measures to solve it.

questions.uddipok:
Read the beginning of a story. Write at least ten new sentences to complete the story and give a title to it.
Once there was a small boy named Bayazid. He was very brilliant and devoted to his mother. One night he was studying by the side of the bed of his mother who was ill. Suddenly his mother woke up and told him to give her a glass of water. But……………

sub_questions.explanation:
Once there was a small boy named Bayazid. He was very brilliant and devoted to his mother. One night he was studying by the side of the bed of his mother who was ill. Suddenly his mother woke up and told him to give her a glass of water. But he found that there was no water in the house.

Without any hesitation, Bayazid took the water pot and went out in search of water. It was a dark and cold night, and everyone was asleep. He walked a long distance to the nearest well. After collecting the water, he hurried back home. But when he reached home, he saw that his mother had fallen asleep again.

Bayazid did not want to wake her up. So, he stood beside her bed with the glass of water in his hand. He remained standing the whole night, waiting patiently for his mother to wake up. When his mother opened her eyes in the morning, she was surprised to see Bayazid standing with the glass of water. Tears came to her eyes, and she hugged her son with love.

Bayazid’s deep love and respect for his mother made him a great man later in life. His story continues to inspire children to honor and care for their pa
rents.

questions.uddipok: Look at the following pie-chart. It shows export sectors in Bangladesh that earn foreign currency. Now describe the pie-chart in around 150 1 50 150 words. You should highlight and summarize the information given in the pie-chart.

sub_questions.explanation:
Here is a sample paragraph based on the pie chart you provided:
The pie-chart shows the major export sectors in Bangladesh that earn foreign currency. Among them, the Ready-made Garments (RMG) sector is the most dominant, contributing the highest portion with 60% of total export earnings. This indicates that the garment industry plays a crucial role in Bangladesh's economy. The second largest sector is jute and jute goods, making up 10% of the exports. Following this, frozen food, such as shrimp and fish, accounts for 8%. Other export sectors include leather and leather products (6%), agricultural products (5%), and pharmaceuticals (4%). Handicrafts, tea, and others contribute smaller portions of 3%, 2%, and 2% respectively. The chart clearly highlights that while a few sectors contribute significantly, the economy heavily relies on garments. To reduce dependency on a single sector, Bangladesh should diversify its export products and focus on developing other potential industries for sustainable economic growth.

questions.uddipok: Suppose, you are Samin/Samia. Recently you have celebrated your 16th birthday party. You have a best friend named Habib/Habiba who has sent a nice gift for you on the occasion of your birthday. Now write a letter to your friend thanking him/her for sending the gift.

sub_questions.explanation:

The gift was perfect and exactly what I needed! I can’t wait to show it off and let everyone know how amazing my best friend is. Your kindness and generosity never cease to amaze me.

With lots of love
Samin/Samia

questions.uddipok:
Suppose, you are Ahnaf/Ahona and your friend is Mohon/Mohona who is weak in English.

Now, write a dialogue between you and your friend about the ways of improving English.

sub_questions.explanation:
Ahnaf: Hey Mohon, I noticed you're having a tough time with English. What’s going on?

Mohon: Yeah, Ahnaf. I find it really hard to speak and understand English. I’m just not good at it.

Ahnaf: Don’t worry, Mohon. English can be tricky, but there are ways to improve. For starters, you could try reading books or watching movies in English. That helps you get used to the language.

Mohon: I tried reading, but I don’t always understand the words. What can I do?

Ahnaf: You can use a dictionary to look up unfamiliar words, or you can use apps on your phone to translate words quickly. Also, try reading aloud. It’ll help you with pronunciation.

Mohon: Okay, I’ll try that. But what about speaking? I’m too nervous to speak in English with others.

Ahnaf: That’s totally normal! But the more you practice, the more confident you’ll get. We can practice together. Just try speaking with me, and I’ll help you if you make any mistakes.

Mohon: Thanks, Ahnaf! I’m still a bit scared, but I’ll try to speak more. What else can I do?

Ahnaf: Another tip is to listen to English podcasts or songs. Pay attention to how they speak. You’ll pick up a lot of new words and improve your listening skills.

Mohon: That sounds fun! I’ll start listening to English songs and try speaking more.

Ahnaf: Great! And don’t stress about making mistakes. That’s how you learn. Just keep practicing, and you’ll improve for sure.

Mohon: Thanks, Ahnaf. I feel better now! I’ll definitely practice more.

Ahnaf: You’re welcome, Mohon. Keep at it, and you’ll do awesome!
